intro: Erysimum asperum var. capitatum, commonly known as the rough wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a biennial or short-lived perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features gray-green, hairy leaves and produces clusters of yellow or orange flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and borders. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
